sentence: Chicago, IL - October 09, 2015 - Today, Zacks Equity Research discusses the Consumer Staples, part 2, including Procter & Gamble Co. ( PG ), General Mills Inc. ( GIS ), Molson Coors Brewing Co. ( TAP ), Keurig Green Mountain, Inc. ( GMCR ) and Starbucks Corp. ( SBUX ).
Stocks have bounced back strongly in recent sessions following the soft September jobs report on hopes of delayed Fed action.
These fresh questions about the near-term U.S. economic picture add to existing uncertainty about China and the broader global economy.
These doubts notwithstanding, key areas of the U.S. economy appear to be doing just fine.
The housing recovery is still in place and while the factory sector seems to be struggling, the picture on the services side is fairly stable.
Cheaper gasoline prices and a rise in wages have increased household wealth, which eventually boosted consumer spending.
A number of retailers and fast food chains have hiked wages.
Consumers are also expecting lower inflation, primarily due to lower gas prices.
While gradual improvement in the macro-economic scenario would act as a growth driver, stabilized commodity costs will also help improve profit margins for certain staples companies.
The favorable margins should help offset some of the negative effects that unfavorable currency typically has on earnings.
Even if these improvements are modest in absolute terms, they add to the Consumer Staples sector's existing attractiveness given its defensive attributes.
Here are some of the key factors that have been driving consumer staple stocks since the past few quarters and also have the potential to boost earnings in the near term.
In a crowded and competitive space, consumer product companies need to regularly innovate and upgrade their brands to create differentiated value propositions to remain successful.
In fact, companies with innovative products in their pipeline will be in a position to benefit.
Innovation has been a driving force for consumer product giants like The Procter & Gamble Co. ( PG ) and cereal maker General Mills Inc. ( GIS ).
P&G believes that consistent product innovation, supported by strong marketing and commercialization, will help deliver stronger results over the long term.
Global brewer Molson Coors Brewing Co. ( TAP ) has also been launching new products to boost revenues and market share, which help it to offset the impact of declining volumes.
Molson Coors also invests in marketing and advertising to create brand awareness.
Keurig Green Mountain, Inc. ( GMCR ) has stirred up a revolution with its innovative and exclusive offerings in its single-serve coffee category in order to remain competitive.
In September, with the launch of its much-hyped product -- Keurig KOLD brewer -- it entered the cold beverage space, which is five times the size of the hot beverage market.

For the hot brewer, the company already has strategic agreements with several other coffee and beverage companies like Starbucks Corp. ( SBUX ) to offer signature drinks of these companies in Keurig Green Mountain's K-Cups and Vue packs.
